title.narrative: COMMUNICATION ON VIOLENCE AND ABUSE

description.narrative: Decision makers and communities understand issues concerning violence and abuse against children, including available protection services, which contributes to Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect of children

title.narrative: Decision makers and communities understand issues concerning violence and abuse against children, including available protectionservices

description.narrative: Decision makers and communities understand issues concerning violence and abuse against children, including available protection services | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/08/2016

title.narrative: of individuals reached in UN supported districts with interventions that focus on child protection prevention

target.value: 2016:800 parents on parenting practices, 100,000 individuals on VANE, 50,000 children in schools

actual.value: 2016:In 19 districts, a total of 15,228 parents/caregivers have been reached with The Parenting Education Programme, 7,540 primary school children reached with VAC prevention messages and the weekly radio program WalindeWatoto broadcast by 19 local stations that have an estimate catchment of 20,000,000

title.narrative: . of cases of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation of children reported in selected districts

actual.value: 2016:436 children (283 girls and 153 boys) were reported to need protection assistance in 19 districts from January 2016. This makes a total of 3,615 children (2,159 girls and 1,456 boys) since the beginning of the country programme
